hints.text: Nowadays, I am mostly famous for making other people famous.
hints.explanationText: Nobel is best known for the prizes that honor others, not his own work.

hints.text: My invention meant for construction ended up shaping warfare.
hints.explanationText: Dynamite was designed for mining and construction but became widely used in war.

hints.text: Seeing how I was described publicly changed how I thought about my legacy.
hints.explanationText: A premature obituary called Nobel a �merchant of death,� reportedly influencing his decision to establish the prizes.

hints.text: I was a Swedish chemist and engineer active in the 19th century.
hints.explanationText: This places Nobel historically and professionally.

hints.text: I established the Nobel Prizes through my will.
hints.explanationText: Nobel left his fortune to fund the prizes after his death.

solutionExplanation: The clues lead to Alfred Nobel, whose invention of dynamite and concern over his legacy resulted in the Nobel Prizes that made him famous for honoring others.
